intro: Stramonium infernale, commonly known as devil's weed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and large, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. Stramonium infernale contains various toxic alkaloids, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
